intro: Strongylocalyx leptostachyus, commonly known as the slender-stemmed strongylocalyx, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Asia, particularly India and Sri Lanka, where it thrives in humid, warm climates. The plant is characterized by its narrow, upright stems and clusters of small, pale yellow or greenish flowers. Its leaves are typically ovate to lanceolate in shape, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and ability to bloom throughout the growing season.
